column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Avoid Dealer Status to Obtain Capital Gains
#Text=Two different groups purchase and sell capital assets : dealers and investors .
#Text=Dealers are generally subject to more stringent financial and tax laws and regulations .
#Text=If you are considered a dealer , you will not be able to claim capital gains on , for example , the sale of a property ; the sale will be considered business income .
#Text=Capital assets include both securities and real estate .
#Text=Of the two , real estate transactions are usually more complex .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide what you want to do with the property you own .
#Text=If you own a house , you may want to make improvements or sell the property .
#Text=Obtaining capital gains when you sell the property may be dependent upon whether you live in the house and how long you have owned the house .
#Text=The process of " flipping " a house , or buying and selling it within a short period of time , may put you in the dealer category .
#Text=The method you use to sell a house could also affect dealer status .
#Text=You might advertise the home as " For Sale By Owner " on a sign that you place on your front lawn to avoid being seen as a dealer .
#Text=If you advertise in multiple newspapers and on television , you may be seen as a dealer .
#Text=Limit the number of properties you sell .
#Text=If you own multiple properties and sell and buy properties
#Text=frequently , the government may view you as a dealer .
#Text=There is an extensive legal case history that determines the parameters for dealer status .
#Text=Subdividing a property for the purpose profit could propel you to dealer status .
#Text=Frequency and the extent to which you develop a property to be divided also plays a role .
#Text=In one case , a person with a non-real-estate job sold several lots of land over a twenty-year period and obtained capital gains .
#Text=Do n't set up an office from which you purchase and sell real property .
#Text=Professional real estate agents have offices .
#Text=If you open an office , the government may consider you a dealer .
#Text=Avoid hiring someone to sell your property , as in a person over which you have a supervisory role or a person who you have on a payroll .
#Text=The government may consider this an activity consistent with being a real estate professional , which would put you in the dealer category .
#Text=Devote only a small portion of your time to purchasing and selling property to avoid dealer status .
#Text=If you avoid devoting a significant amount of time to selling a property , the government may not consider you to be a dealer .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The factors that influence dealer status in real estate are evaluated on a case-by-case basis ; no single determinant is more important than another .
#Text=Avoiding dealer status may help lower your tax rate .
#Text=In the United States , the 2011 tax rate for dealers who sell a property is 35 percent ; those who obtain capital gains are taxed at a rate of 15 percent .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Investors should carefully review the rules that govern transactions involving capital assets to avoid dealer status and associated capital gains issues .
